title: UniXGen: A Unified Vision-Language Model for Multi-View Chest X-ray Generation and Report Generation. (arXiv:2302.12172v4 [eess.IV] UPDATED)
abstract: Generated synthetic data in medical research can substitute privacy and security-sensitive data with a large-scale curated dataset, reducing data collection and annotation costs. As part of this effort, we propose UniXGen, a unified chest X-ray and report generation model, with the following contributions. First, we design a unified model for bidirectional chest X-ray and report generation by adopting a vector quantization method to discretize chest X-rays into discrete visual tokens and formulating both tasks as sequence generation tasks. Second, we introduce several special tokens to generate chest X-rays with specific views that can be useful when the desired views are unavailable. tldr: 提出了UniXGen模型，它是一个能够生成胸部X光和相关报告的视觉语言模型，通过将胸部X光离散化为离散令牌并将两个任务都制定为序列生成任务，实现了胸部X光和报告的双向生成，并引入特殊令牌以生成具有特定视图的胸部X光。
en_tdlr: UniXGen is a unified vision-language model which can generate chest X-rays and associated reports by discretizing X-rays into tokens and formulating both tasks as sequence generation tasks. Special tokens are introduced to generate X-rays with specific views, and the model can flexibly take various inputs to take advantage of the additional findings available in other X-ray views.
